match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 7 wickets (with 134 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 15.00 start, First Session 15.00-18.30 Interval 18.30-19.15, Second Session 19.15-22.45

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Nasir Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Soumya Sarkar b Nasir Hossain 41 (64b 3x4 0x6 102m) SR: 64.06

dismissalComment.html: Faf du Plessis steps out and holes out. Bangladesh have their man. Tossed up on middle, he skips down the track and mis-hits the lofted strike to the right of long-on. Sarkar runs across and takes it. Faf aimed to bisect deep midwicket and long-on. No dice. Big, big wicket for the hosts. South Africa five down...

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 36 (44b 2x4 1x6 84m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Another slower ball, this one at 111ks, Behardien rocks back and hits a pull/rather drags it to deep midwicket. Nasir Hossain pouches it safely at the edge of the boundary

Nasir gets RR first ball. He has missed a straight ball. Hurries on with the arm on off, RR camps back in the crease and wants to slap it through the covers after stepping away a touch but does not connect. The off stump is rattled and the crowd roars with Nasir. 4 off 24 balls; end of a jittery little knock. It was going nowhere

Faf du Plessis steps out and holes out. Bangladesh have their man. Tossed up on middle, he skips down the track and mis-hits the lofted strike to the right of long-on. Sarkar runs across and takes it. Faf aimed to bisect deep midwicket and long-on. No dice. Big, big wicket for the hosts. South Africa five down...
Abott perishes... Slides on at 90ks and traps him bang in front of middle. Abott camped back, missing the attempted defensive push. Nine down

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Prancing delivery. Mustafizur strikes and claps his hands in joy. This one explodes from a shortish length and outside off, leaving QdK squared up. Popped to backward point off the shoulder of the bat. Sabbir moves to his right and swallows it

Mustafizur comes back and takes out Duminy with another of those offcutters. On a length and outside off at 127.3ks, Duminy is early into his stroke as he drives in the air and chips it to short cover. Mustafizur is pleased as punch. Sabbir goes to his left and takes it

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled'em. The offcutter does the damage again as the middle stump is tilted back. This one swerves in at 120.7ks, rips through the bat-pad gap and timberrrr! Rabada was perhaps early into the flick. Replays show that it clipped the back pad and hit top of middle

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman 2 (9b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: Prancing delivery. Mustafizur strikes and claps his hands in joy. This one explodes from a shortish length and outside off, leaving QdK squared up. Popped to backward point off the shoulder of the bat. Sabbir moves to his right and swallows it

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Rubel Hossain 22 (37b 3x4 0x6 56m) SR: 59.45

dismissalComment.html: Rubel razes the off stump. It goes for a toss. He is mobbed by his team-mates. The umpires check for a possible no-ball. Rubel is okay and Amla has to go. Back of a length, nips in a touch on off, hurries onto Amla. He does not connect with the across-the-line flick. Rubel nails the top of off

dismissalText.commentary: Rilee Rossouw b Nasir Hossain 4 (24b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Nasir gets RR first ball. He has missed a straight ball. Hurries on with the arm on off, RR camps back in the crease and wants to slap it through the covers after stepping away a touch but does not connect. The off stump is rattled and the crowd roars with Nasir. 4 off 24 balls; end of a jittery little knock. It was going nowhere

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mahmudullah 9 (24b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe claims the catch. Miller walks off. South Africa slide further. Miller steps out,  Mahmudullah is aware of it as he fires it flat on the pads. He does not meet the pitch of the ball, neither does he time the attempted flick. Chipped tamely to short midwicket, where Mashrafe bends low, dives forward and snaffles a sharp catch

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Nasir Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Soumya Sarkar b Nasir Hossain 41 (64b 3x4 0x6 102m) SR: 64.06

dismissalComment.html: Faf du Plessis steps out and holes out. Bangladesh have their man. Tossed up on middle, he skips down the track and mis-hits the lofted strike to the right of long-on. Sarkar runs across and takes it. Faf aimed to bisect deep midwicket and long-on. No dice. Big, big wicket for the hosts. South Africa five down...

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman 13 (21b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 61.9

dismissalComment.html: Mustafizur comes back and takes out Duminy with another of those offcutters. On a length and outside off at 127.3ks, Duminy is early into his stroke as he drives in the air and chips it to short cover. Mustafizur is pleased as punch. Sabbir goes to his left and takes it

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris lbw b Rubel Hossain 12 (13b 3x4 0x6 18m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: The forefinger goes up. Morris has been pinned lbw. Bangladesh are all over South Africa. This was full and slides in with the angle to ping him below the knee-roll on the front pad as he is late onto the flick. It would have hit the leg stump. Rubel roars and pumps his fist

dismissalComment.html: bowled'em. The offcutter does the damage again as the middle stump is tilted back. This one swerves in at 120.7ks, rips through the bat-pad gap and timberrrr! Rabada was perhaps early into the flick. Replays show that it clipped the back pad and hit top of middle

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Abbott lbw b Nasir Hossain 5 (11b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: Abott perishes... Slides on at 90ks and traps him bang in front of middle. Abott camped back, missing the attempted defensive push. Nine down

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 36 (44b 2x4 1x6 84m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Another slower ball, this one at 111ks, Behardien rocks back and hits a pull/rather drags it to deep midwicket. Nasir Hossain pouches it safely at the edge of the boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar not out 88 (79b 13x4 1x6 126m) SR: 111.39
Mahmudullah c Amla b Abbott 50 (64b 6x4 0x6 98m) SR: 78.12

dismissalComment.html: and he perishes next ball. Fullish and on middle, right in the flicking radar. He does not connect properly and lobs it to Amla at short midwicket. Abbott's footing is okay. Consolatory wicket for Abbott

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rabada nabs Tamim first ball. He nips down the track and gets a shortish ball touching 140ks. He throws his bat at it and drags it back onto the leg stump off a thick inside edge. It gets knocked out. Rabada is pumped

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Knocked'em over! Rabada softened his prey with a short ball and then made the incision with a fuller ball. No lateral movement, Litton goes for an across-the-line hack and does not connect. Rabada fires out the off stump

and he perishes next ball. Fullish and on middle, right in the flicking radar. He does not connect properly and lobs it to Amla at short midwicket. Abbott's footing is okay. Consolatory wicket for Abbott

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Rabada 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 5m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Rabada nabs Tamim first ball. He nips down the track and gets a shortish ball touching 140ks. He throws his bat at it and drags it back onto the leg stump off a thick inside edge. It gets knocked out. Rabada is pumped

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das b Rabada 17 (14b 2x4 1x6 15m) SR: 121.42

dismissalComment.html: Knocked'em over! Rabada softened his prey with a short ball and then made the incision with a fuller ball. No lateral movement, Litton goes for an across-the-line hack and does not connect. Rabada fires out the off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Amla b Abbott 50 (64b 6x4 0x6 98m) SR: 78.12

dismissalComment.html: and he perishes next ball. Fullish and on middle, right in the flicking radar. He does not connect properly and lobs it to Amla at short midwicket. Abbott's footing is okay. Consolatory wicket for Abbott

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh win, they square the series, and secure their Champions Trophy spot! Soumya seals it with a six. Tossed up and outside off, he goes for a slog-sweep. Rabada at deep midwicket leaps, gets both hands but can only parry it over the boundary, leaving the fans grooving and jiving. Mirpur in full blast...

commentPostTextItems.html: Bangladesh have struck back to force the series into the decider in Chittagong. Do join us for the climax on Wednesday. Until then, goodbye and good night.

Himel: "How Ban are through"? --- Ban are currently on 94, and even if they lose the 3rd ODI they'll be on 93, which will still be enough to get them through. It's not possible for both Pak and WI to go past 93.
Soumya Sarkar is the Man of the Match

Mashrafe Mortaza: This was a much-needed win. The last eight months we have been playing well, we lost last four matches but we have come back. Toss is becoming a concern in Bangladesh but the bowlers restricted them. The way Mustafiz bowled was fantastic to see. Nasir delivered and Shakib is a big player. It is a good sign for us and the batters stepped up as well. After coming back from injury, Mahmudullah did well and hopefully he will continue. As long as our process is right we will play well.

9:30pm: Hashim Amla: It was not a 160-wicket, we had a really bad day and did not apply ourselves. Credit to Bangladesh. The key on this wicket is to get in and make it count. We did not do that today. We had a chance when they were 20 for 2 but Soumya played well. Rabada is a wonderful talent. Hopefully, he goes from strength. 160 is difficult to defend.

9:18pm Kagiso Rabada punched early holes in the chase, leaving Bangladesh at 24 for 2 inside five overs, but Soumya Sarkar collared the attack and led the chase with 88* off 79 balls, punctuated by some lashing drives and cuts through the off side. Mahmadullah took a back seat to Soumya's positive approach, before opening up and reaching a fifty of his own. It was only fitting that Soumya finished the chase with a six with seven wickets and more than 20 overs to spare.
Nayeem: "This is Bangladesh's biggest margin of victory against any test playing nation in terms of balls remaining."
Shibly: "Congratulations Bangladesh Tigers. They have beaten Pak, Ind and now SA. This is the new Bangladesh."
Saad: "So, who is going to miss out for champions trophy? Pak or WI?"
Milton: "It is Bangladesh's first ODI win over South Africa?" --- Nope, second
zeeshan : "Yesterday malik finished with a six and today sarkar finish it with a six "

commentTextItems.html: Variety from Tahir. Wrong'un, floated up on middle and rips away sharply with extra bounce. Beaten
darted full, kept out
slid through short on the leg stump, Soumya rocks back as he pulls through backward square leg
another full toss, Shakib misses out again as he drives it straight to mid-off

commentPostTextItems.html: Abu Obaida Imon: "@Nes, He's becoming one for Ban! "

commentTextItems.html: low full toss on middle, tamely tapped back to the bowler
speared full and on a fourth-stump line, Shakib squeezes out a drive to mid-off
very full and on middle, Shakib seeks to turn to leg, gets a leading edge to off

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Amla b Abbott 50 (64b 6x4 0x6 98m) SR: 78.12

commentTextItems.html: and he perishes next ball. Fullish and on middle, right in the flicking radar. He does not connect properly and lobs it to Amla at short midwicket. Abbott's footing is okay. Consolatory wicket for Abbott
Mahmudullah gets to a fifty of his own. He raises his bat and acknowledges the cheers. Banged in short, Mahmadullah controls a pull over backward square leg
full toss drifting down leg, Soumya sinks to one knee and put it away to long leg with a sweep

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full and outside off, Soumya dances down the track and drills it in the gap beween the covers and mid-off. The man at covers dives in vain
googly outside off, pokes and misses
good length on off, driven to extra cover
overpitched and outside off, lashed away towards mid-off. The fielder dives to his left and stops the ball
down the track and driven to mid-on
too full and straight, clipped to the right of short midwicket. They hare across for the second

commentPostTextItems.html: mohi hossain: "Well, Soumya could be the future of Bangladesh, at least in ODIs."

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: bumper with more legs on it. Ducked under
short and on the hips, Soumya swivels on the back foot as he pulls it to deep backward square leg
another full toss, whipped to midwicket. Amla dives as he makes a half-save, deflecting it to mid-on

The off stump is rattled and the crowd roars with Nasir. 4 off 24 balls; end of a jittery little knock. It was going nowhere

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mahmudullah 9 (24b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe claims the catch. Miller walks off. South Africa slide further. Miller steps out,  Mahmudullah is aware of it as he fires it flat on the pads. He does not meet the pitch of the ball, neither does he time the attempted flick. Chipped tamely to short midwicket, where Mashrafe bends low, dives forward and snaffles a sharp catch

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Nasir Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Soumya Sarkar b Nasir Hossain 41 (64b 3x4 0x6 102m) SR: 64.06

dismissalComment.html: Faf du Plessis steps out and holes out. Bangladesh have their man. Tossed up on middle, he skips down the track and mis-hits the lofted strike to the right of long-on. Sarkar runs across and takes it. Faf aimed to bisect deep midwicket and long-on. No dice. Big, big wicket for the hosts. South Africa five down...

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman 13 (21b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 61.9

dismissalComment.html: Mustafizur comes back and takes out Duminy with another of those offcutters. On a length and outside off at 127.3ks, Duminy is early into his stroke as he drives in the air and chips it to short cover. Mustafizur is pleased as punch. Sabbir goes to his left and takes it

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris lbw b Rubel Hossain 12 (13b 3x4 0x6 18m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: The forefinger goes up. Morris has been pinned lbw. Bangladesh are all over South Africa. This was full and slides in with the angle to ping him below the knee-roll on the front pad as he is late onto the flick. It would have hit the leg stump. Rubel roars and pumps his fist

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada b Mustafizur Rahman 10 (25b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: bowled'em. The offcutter does the damage again as the middle stump is tilted back. This one swerves in at 120.7ks, rips through the bat-pad gap and timberrrr! Rabada was perhaps early into the flick. Replays show that it clipped the back pad and hit top of middle

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Abbott lbw b Nasir Hossain 5 (11b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: Abott perishes... Slides on at 90ks and traps him bang in front of middle. Abott camped back, missing the attempted defensive push. Nine down

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 36 (44b 2x4 1x6 84m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Another slower ball, this one at 111ks, Behardien rocks back and hits a pull/rather drags it to deep midwicket. Nasir Hossain pouches it safely at the edge of the boundary

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Rabada 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 5m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Rabada nabs Tamim first ball. He nips down the track and gets a shortish ball touching 140ks. He throws his bat at it and drags it back onto the leg stump off a thick inside edge. It gets knocked out. Rabada is pumped

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar not out 88 (79b 13x4 1x6 126m) SR: 111.39

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das b Rabada 17 (14b 2x4 1x6 15m) SR: 121.42

dismissalComment.html: Knocked'em over! Rabada softened his prey with a short ball and then made the incision with a fuller ball. No lateral movement, Litton goes for an across-the-line hack and does not connect. Rabada fires out the off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Amla b Abbott 50 (64b 6x4 0x6 98m) SR: 78.12

dismissalComment.html: and he perishes next ball. Fullish and on middle, right in the flicking radar. He does not connect properly and lobs it to Amla at short midwicket. Abbott's footing is okay. Consolatory wicket for Abbott

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan not out 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 38 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40 (89 runs, 6 wickets)
South Africa: 50 runs in 15.6 overs (96 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: South Africa - 50/2 in 16.0 overs (F du Plessis 19, RR Rossouw 2)
Over 25.2: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - F du Plessis (Struck down)
Over 30.3: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - Enamul Haque, Batsman - F Behardien (Upheld)
South Africa: 100 runs in 31.3 overs (189 balls), Extras 6
Drinks: South Africa - 100/6 in 31.5 overs (F Behardien 3)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50 (35 runs, 3 wickets)
South Africa: 150 runs in 43.1 overs (259 balls), Extras 7
Innings Break: South Africa - 162/10 in 46.0 overs (Imran Tahir 1)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 57 runs, 2 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 8.4 overs (53 balls), Extras 3
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40 (110 runs, 1 wicket)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 56 balls (Soumya Sarkar 27, Mahmudullah 17, Ex 6)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 86/2 in 14.0 overs (Soumya Sarkar 36, Mahmudullah 21)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 16.3 overs (101 balls), Extras 7
Soumya Sarkar: 50 off 47 balls (9 x 4)
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 108 balls (Soumya Sarkar 61, Mahmudullah 33, Ex 6)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 25.5 overs (157 balls), Extras 7
Mahmudullah: 50 off 63 balls (6 x 4)

milestones.description: Shakib has scored 6 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record
Tamim Iqbal has scored 36 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015

stories.title: Mashrafe lauds Bangladesh's mentally strong outlook
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe Mortaza lauds Bangladesh's mentally strong outlook
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza, Bangladesh's ODI captain, was pleased with the manner in which his team bounced back with a seven-wicket win over South Africa in the second ODI in Mirpur, levelling the three-match series with one game still to be played

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar celebrates his fifty
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar celebrates his fifty, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, July 12, 2015

stories.title: Rossouw found guilty for Tamim shoulder barge
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 2nd ODI, Dhaka
stories.seoTitle: Rossouw found guilty for Tamim shoulder barge
stories.summary: The ICC has found Rilee Rossouw guilty of breaching Article 2.2.7 of the ICC Code of Conduct, after he was involved in a shoulder-barging incident with Tamim Iqbal during the second ODI in Mirpur

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal gets an inside edge on to his stumps off Kagiso Rabada
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal gets an inside edge on to his stumps off Kagiso Rabada, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, July 12, 2015

stories.title: 'I wanted to take them on' - Soumya
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 2nd ODI, Dhaka
stories.seoTitle: 'I wanted to take them on' - Soumya
stories.summary: After scoring an unbeaten 88 which secured Bangladesh's seven-wicket win against South Africa, Soumya Sarkar revealed that he kept trying to pull the short balls since he was confident he had the mindset to take on the visitors' attack

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar struck six fours and a six in his 37
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar struck six fours and a six in his 37, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd T20I, Mirpur, July 7, 2015

stories.title: Rubel's comeback promises more
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: He took two wickets, he didn't go for too many runs. It wasn't the most eye-catching performance. But Rubel Hossain has shown the capacity to develop as an all-round bowling option

image.caption: Rubel Hossain is ecstatic after dismissing Hashim Amla
image.longCaption: Rubel Hossain is ecstatic after dismissing Hashim Amla, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, July 12, 2015

stories.title: Bangladesh square series, seal Champions Trophy place

stories.summary: It has taken Bangladesh eight years and eight completed ODIs to record a second ever victory over South Africa, which came with some added bonuses

stories.title: One slot in Bangladesh XI still undecided - Hassan
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: One slot in Bangladesh XI still undecided - Hassan
stories.summary: The Bangladesh team's training session on Saturday was delayed by more than an hour after the players were called into a meeting with Bangladesh Cricket Board president Nazmul Hassan

image.longCaption: BCB president Nazmul Hassan addresses the media, Dhaka, September 25, 2014

stories.title: Clinical South Africa look to close out series
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Clinical South Africa look to close out series
stories.summary: Bangladesh, having been comprehensively beaten in all the matches this series, will be desperate to conjure some of the fight they showed against Pakistan and India

videos.title: Bangladesh's home bilateral streak
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
videos.summary: Bangladesh notched up yet another win in a home bilateral series - taking their tally over the last two years to 17 - while South Africa suffered from a batting blip in the second ODI between the two sides in Mirpur
